title: What new transcripts on Jan. 6 may reveal about Trump's mindset
description: New transcripts reveal how Donald Trump approached the aftermath of the January 6 insurrection at the US Capitol, including pushing for pardons for those around him. Rep. Adam Schiff (D-CA) weighs in on the details with CNN's Wolf Blitzer.

title: Guns temporarily banned from Brazil's capital ahead of Lula da Silva's inauguration
description: A Brazilian Supreme Court judge on Wednesday issued a four-day ban on carrying firearms in the capital as a precautionary measure ahead of the January 1 inauguration of President-elect Luiz Inácio "Lula" da Silva.

title: Tent processing center for migrants going up in El Paso, expected to increase capacity by 1,000
description: In response to the increased number of migrants crossing the border in El Paso, US Customs and Border Protection is erecting a soft-sided tent facility to increase migrant processing capacity by about 1,000, according to Landon Hutchens, US Customs and Border Protection spokesperson.

title: See moment waitress receives $1,000 tip on Christmas Day
description: Callie Blue, a waitress at a diner outside Madison, Wisconsin, never expected one of her customers to leave her a generous tip. Then she met Michael Johnson on Christmas Day. CNN affiliate Spectrum News Madison has more.

title: 'Have you no shame': Congressman-elect Santos grilled after admitting to 'embellishing' resume
description: Republican New York congressman-elect George Santos was grilled on Fox News about fabricating parts of his resume.

title: CNN reporter reveals 'shocking experience' covering Russia's invasion of Ukraine
description: CNN's Matthew Chance reflects on his key takeaways covering Russia's invasion of Ukraine since the beginning of the conflict.

title: Suspect in Paul Pelosi attack pleads not guilty to state charges
description: In a short court hearing Wednesday, David DePape entered a second not guilty plea to state charges stemming from an attack on Paul Pelosi, the husband of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, in late October. A second arraignment for felony charges is customary in California following a preliminary hearing in which a defendant is held to answer to all charges.

title: The world's 'best' villages for tourism have been announced
description: Travel has changed in many ways since the pandemic started, but one change for the better is the new push towards rural tourism. Where before we were intent on ticking off yet another city break, in lockdown we started dreaming of the great outdoors -- and that still hasn't changed.

title: Woman sent family video of blizzard conditions. She was later found dead in her car
description: Anndel Taylor, 22, was found dead over the holiday weekend in Buffalo after being trapped in her car by the blizzard paralyzing western New York, her family told CNN on Tuesday. CNN's Athena Jones reports.

title: NASA images showcase eerie beauty of winter on Mars
description: Mars may seem like a dry, desolate place, but the red planet transforms into an otherworldly wonderland in winter, according to a new video shared by NASA.

title: Convicted member of plot to kidnap Michigan governor sentenced to nearly 20 years in federal prison
description: A Michigan federal judge sentenced a man convicted of plotting to kidnap Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer to nearly 20 years in prison Wednesday.

title: Biden administration renews commitment to free Paul Whelan on fourth anniversary of his detention in Russia
description: The Biden administration on Wednesday renewed its commitment to secure the release of American Paul Whelan on the fourth anniversary of his wrongful detention in Russia, as Whelan's family expressed hope that he would not mark yet another milestone in Russian prison.

title: Throwback tech continues to fascinate us. Do we want an analog future?
description: In 2022, we're more plugged in than ever.

title: Fog blamed for deadly 200-vehicle pileup. See the stunning footage
description: The major incident happened on a bridge in the Chinese city of Zhengzhou and was caused by extreme fog, according to Reuters.

title: Jordan king says prepared for conflict if Jerusalem status changes
description: Jordan's king says he is prepared for conflict should the status of Jerusalem's holy sites change as Israel prepares to swear in what is likely to be the most right-wing government in its history.

title: CNN report: The world's harshest quarantine is no more
description: As Covid sweeps through China, the country is scrapping quarantines for inbound travelers and promising to gradually restart outbound tourism. CNN international correspondent Selina Wang has more.

title: These are the best and worst TikTok wellness trends of 2022
description: TikTok can be great for many things, such as recipes, style inspiration, cat videos or comedy relief. But when it comes to wellness trends, following all of TikTok users' suggestions could mean gambling with your health.

title: How Dr Pepper went from local favorite to major player
description: In the pantheon of sodas, Dr Pepper is the odd one out: It doesn't have the popularity or sales of Coca-Cola or Pepsi, you can't use it in a standard cocktail, and it doesn't fall neatly into a category like cola or root beer.

title: He lost to Santos. Hear him weigh in on his opponent's lies
description: GOP Rep.-elect George Santos admits to fabricating sections of his resume, including his past work experience and education. Democrat Robert Zimmerman, the candidate who lost to Santos, calls out his former opponent.

title: US woman found dead in her car after getting trapped by snow, family says
description: A 22-year-old woman was found dead over the holiday weekend in Buffalo after being trapped in her car by the blizzard paralyzing western New York, her family told CNN on Tuesday.

title: Iranian woman takes part in international chess tournament without mandatory hijab
description: Iranian chess player Sara Khadem, also known as Sarasadat Khademalsharieh, took part in an international tournament without a hijab, Iranian news outlet Jamaran said on Tuesday.

title: Southwest CEO responds to backlash over cancellations
description: Southwest Airlines CEO Bob Jordan released an apology to stranded travelers as the beleaguered airline continues to grapple with what US Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg has referred to as a complete "meltdown" of the system. In all, Southwest has canceled more than 15,700 flights since winter weather began disrupting air travel on December 22.

title: Ariana Grande still donates Christmas gifts to child patients years after Manchester attack
description: Ariana Grande has brought some festive sparkle to young patients across Manchester in England once again, after donating gifts to children's hospitals in the city this Christmas.

title: This Afghan interpreter risked his life for US Marines. Now, they're fighting for him to stay in the US
description: It was November 2010 and a platoon of Marines was patrolling outside of a village in Helmand Province, Afghanistan -- slowly, and carefully, to avoid accidentally stepping on hidden improvised explosive devices. They walked in a single file line meant to reduce the risk of multiple Marines being taken out in one blast.

title: Kherson city attacked 23 times in past 24 hours, Ukraine says
Russian troops fighting in Ukraine can freeze their sperm for free
description: Russian soldiers taking part in the war on Ukraine will be eligible for free sperm freezing and storage in cryobanks,  Russia's state news agency Tass reported, citing a lawyers union.

title: Wall Street's dirty secret: It's terrible at forecasting stocks
description: December is a month full of market predictions for the year to come. Everyone, from economists to analysts to grocers, seems to have a strong feeling about how stocks will behave going forward.

title: Devastating disasters and flickers of hope: These are the top climate and weather stories of 2022
description: From a small island in Polynesia to the white-sand beaches of Florida, the planet experienced a dizzying number of climate and extreme weather disasters in 2022.

title: US considers Covid-19 measures for travelers from China
description: The US is considering imposing new Covid-19 measures for individuals traveling from China amid concerns over a rise in Covid-19 cases in the country and a "lack of transparent data," US officials said.

title: A double-decker plane seat and other wild moments from 2022
description: It's been another tough year for aviation, as the world returned to flying after the Covid-19 pandemic, only for the industry to be beset by chaos and cancellations. There were silver linings, however, as the industry slowly recovered and progress was made in terms of more environmentally sustainable flying. Here are the highs and lows of what's been a bumpy ride.

title: With more storms on the way, 120,000 along the West Coast have no power after strong winds, heavy rain and snow
description: A strong storm system bringing heavy rain and mountain snow to much of the western United States has left more than 120,000 customers without power as the region braces for more weather woes in the days to come.

title: Lionel Messi isn't expected to be back with PSG until early January after World Cup success
description: Lionel Messi isn't expected to be back with Paris Saint-German until the "2nd or 3rd January," according to the the club's coach Christophe Galtier as the 35-year-old continues to spend time back in Argentina after winning the World Cup following the penalty shootout victory over France in the final.

title: Why ethnic tensions are flaring again in northern Kosovo
description: Protesting Serbs in the ethnically divided city of Mitrovica in northern Kosovo erected new barricades on Tuesday, hours after Serbia said it had put its army on the highest combat alert following weeks of escalating tensions between Belgrade and Pristina.

title: The Bidens make an island escape ahead of consequential 2024 announcement
description: President Joe Biden this week returns to St. Croix, one of his and first lady Jill Biden's beloved vacation spots, seeking a final opportunity for rest before what is expected to be a contentious 2023 and reelection run.

title: Should you attend that New Year's Eve party? Our medical analyst weighs in
description: At the end of 2020 and 2021, many people greeted the start of the coming year hunkered down due to the risk of Covid-19. But now, New Year's Eve events and celebrations are back in a big way. A lot of people have plans to attend social functions, whether they are crowded festivities with thousands or house parties with a few relatives and friends.

title: Former Pope Benedict is 'very sick', Pope Francis says
description: Pope Francis said Wednesday that his predecessor Pope Benedict is "very sick" and asked for prayers for the 95-year-old former pontiff.

title: Nick Kyrgios' late United Cup withdrawal surprises Australia teammates
description: Nick Kyrgios' late withdrawal from the inaugural edition of the United Cup took his own teammates by surprise on Wednesday as they were left in the dark until minutes before their pre-tournament news conference.

title: 'I'm tired as hell,' says Luka Dončić after making NBA history with record-breaking triple-double in the Dallas Mavericks' win over the New York Knicks
description: Luka Dončić put up a historic triple-double in the Dallas Mavericks' thrilling 126-121 overtime win over the New York Knicks on Tuesday.

title: Why three robot sisters could be the friendly face of AI
description: Artificial intelligence (AI) has become an integral part of our everyday lives, found in everything from social media algorithms to e-commerce and navigation, but not everyone is comfortable with the idea. The key to winning over a skeptical public could be a family of robot "sisters."

title: Shiba inu who inspired 'doge' meme is seriously ill with leukemia
description: Kabosu, the internet-famous dog who inspired the "doge" meme and influenced digital culture for a decade, is seriously ill with leukemia and liver disease.

title: Nearly 7,000 Ukrainian civilians killed since Russia's invasion began, UN agency says
As Southwest flight cancellations continue, Buttigieg vows to hold airline accountable
Lonely life for Russian dissidents after hundreds of thousands leave the country
description:
• Live updates: Nearly 7,000 Ukrainians killed since Russia's invasion began
• Russian sausage magnate dies after hotel fall in India
• Why Ukraine peace negotiations remain unlikely

title: Chinese leader Xi's key policy was once a point of pride. By the end of 2022 it has spiraled into a crisis that threatens the ruling Communist Party.
description: 2022 was supposed to be a triumphant year for China and its leader Xi Jinping, as he began his second decade in power with a pledge to restore the nation to greatness.

title: Russian FM: Ukraine must give up occupied territories
description: Russia's Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov issued an ultimatum to Ukraine advising the country to agree to Russia's demands, which includes giving up occupied territory within Ukraine. CNN's Will Ripley reports.

title: UN Security Council 'deeply alarmed' by Taliban restrictions on women
From zero-Covid to unprecedented outbreak, 2022 has been China's year of extremes
Fourth Japan minister exits PM Kishida's four-month-old cabinet
description: Japanese reconstruction minister Kenya Akiba tendered his resignation on Tuesday, becoming the fourth minister to leave the cabinet appointed by Prime Minister Fumio Kishida in August.

title: Despite Putin's claims, Ukraine peace talks look unlikely in near future
'This is stunning': Borger on testimony alleging Meadows burned documents at White House
description: CNN's Gloria Borger and legal analyst Jennifer Rodgers react to newly-released testimony from Cassidy Hutchinson, a top aide to former White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows, in which she told the January 6 committee that she saw Meadows burn documents on multiple occasions at the White House.

title: Russia's foreign minister calls on West for maximum restraint 'in order to minimize nuclear risks'
Tourists flee amid flash floods at this World Heritage Site
description: Sudden flooding caused immediate evacuation for tourists visiting a World Heritage Site in Petra, Jordan.
